title: Bounds and Phase Transitions for Phonons in Complex Network Structures
abstract:
We study a model of networked atoms or molecules oscillating around their
equilibrium positions. The model assumes the harmonic approximation of the
interactions. We provide bounds for the total number of phonons, and for the
specific heat, in terms of the average Wiener capacity, or resistance, of the
network. Thanks to such bounds, we can distinguish qualitatively different
behaviours in terms of the network structure alone.
